basics.name: Mark Bundschuh
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Interested in software development, Linux, homelab & server administration, and cybersecurity.

objective.summary: Internship opportunity for Summer 2024 that lets me apply and grow my skills in software.

work.name: Kudu Dynamics LLC
highlights: Developed VSCode extension in TypeScript to assist in Linux kernel bug triaging process for a DARPA (U.S. Department of Defense research agency) effort.
Continuously field tested the extension on known CVEs (vulnerabilities) to find valuable improvement areas.
Made heavy use of Docker to speed up kernel builds with caching, and QEMU to run and debug the kernel in an isolated virtual machine.
Contributed to daily stand up meetings, sprint planning and retrospectives, as well as code reviews following an Agile-like development process.

work.name: INSIGMA IT Engineering GmbH
highlights: Developed contracting company's internal management dashboard in C# Microsoft ASP.NET, with TypeScript, CSS, and Bootstrap on the client.
Engaged with customers to refine the requirements and deliver a product that met their needs.
Communicated entirely in German in a diverse remote environment based out of Cologne, Germany.
Lead weekly meetings on various cybersecurity topics to students and network with industry professionals.

Host BuckeyeCTF yearly, a competition where last year hosted over 600 teams worldwide online, and over 90 in person players. Solved technical issues and kept 99.9% uptime on over 40 services. Organized and worked through logistical challenges including coordinating with 7 sponsoring companies to provide funding and prizes.

projects.name: rhombus
highlights: Created a Jeopardy style competition platform with a cohesive and modern user interface for hosting CTF events, written in Svelte, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS.
Implemented innovative features in the space such as scriptable health checks and a custom ticket support system interacting with Discord.

projects.name: canvas-cli
highlights: Interactive command line interface tool for automating common tasks as a student in OSU's learning management system using official REST APIs.
Compatibile with any institution's Canvas LMS instance. Cross platform single binary made with Rust.

projects.name: homelab
highlights: Recycled old hardware into personal servers using Kubernetes to breathe new life into them hosting popular service such as Bitwarden, Nextcloud, and Grafana.
Practiced backup and disaster recovery with automated offsite cloud backups to keep important data safe.
